page.title: 01The Otter Valley
page.content: The area is predominantly rural with the village of Offwell in the South- west corner and a large part of the market town of Honiton. Honiton lies on the A30 Exeter-London road and its junction with the A35 to Dorchester. Its railway runs from Exeter to London. The town lies in the vale of the Otter surrounded by the plateaux of East Devon. The agriculture is mixed pastoral, and cereals. The employment is in agriculture, supply and service industries. The town is designated a growth area for East Devon and has ample building land. The 17C heart of the town is surrounded by modern development. In the country the farms are generally ancient and often of cob and thatch.
